website_summaries.verdict: Designed for younger elementary students, Botley teaches principles of coding without a screen – a novel and winning concept that has been a hit with parents.
pros: Kids can program multiple steps and use "if then" commands in their programming
A large variety of possibilities included with activity set
Great for engineering and critical thinking skills
cons: Botley requires five AAA batteries, which aren't included

customer_reviews.title: Botley does not work
customer_reviews.text: I would return it if I could but I bought it over a month in advance of my son's birthday. Several adults have tried, with instructions in hand, to get Botley to follow commands and it does not. It says "hi" when it is switched on and that is all. We tried fresh batteries, still nothing. Needless to say, my 6 year old is not impressed and my money was wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Babyhouse

customer_reviews.title: Screen free fun your kids will ask for!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 6 year old son. He was excited when the box came and couldn't wait to get started. It was easy to assemble and we were using it within 5 minutes of opening the box. After reviewing the basic functions with my son he was able to control Botley with little direction. Even my 3 year was interested and enjoyed Botley but she needed much more guidance and help to control him. This is a wonderful STEM activity for kids that keeps their minds thinking without the use of screens. When my son woke up the next morning he asked for Botley over tv which sold this product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Kloha

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy, easy to code. Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Fun toy. Not too complicated, needed a quick read of the instructions and Botley was working within minutes. He takes inputs from the remote control or select line and he'll follow a dark line (provided on cards or make your own). It doesn't require hooking up to the computer to code, good and bad as there are no codes (scratch) written by the user just button pressing. This is great for beginners but more advanced coders could get bored. It's super cute and has good sayings, even gets dizzy if turned too much. Cool toy but quite expensive for what you get hence the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: C. Woods

customer_reviews.title: So cool!!
customer_reviews.text: This little bot does so much!! Botley makes it ultra fun for my child to learn coding (and since coding is new for me, I get to learn it too lol ;)... He can be programmed to do practically endless amounts of paths, movements, object detections, and loops; plus you can even use his arm attachments for him to move things around... He’s super cute and says different things, keeping smaller kids enticed, but would also be great for bigger kids because of the complex coded tasks he can perform!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Anile

customer_reviews.title: We all love Botley!
customer_reviews.text: We got Botley for our 5yo's birthday, and two days later both our 5yo and her 7yo sister are absolutely in love with their new little friend, we are having a great time together laying out the cards and programming Botley. My 7yo even said we should write a letter to whoever invented Botley because he's a genius and she loves him. Lol!
customer_reviews.author: sigi

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth That Price
customer_reviews.text: If you have money to burn, might as well get this. However, if you are like most Americans, and you're working a full time job and still counting pennies from the couch, like me, this is simply not worth it. This is worth about 20 slave-wage dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Happehness

customer_reviews.title: A fun introduction to programming
customer_reviews.text: I got Botley for my six-year-old daughter and she is really enjoying playing with it. As soon as she received it, she immediately compared it with another bot, Keebo, which she has at her school. She likes Botley because of the remote control as opposed to Keebo, which requires you to line up blocks and scan them. I've found there are a couple of things Botley could be better at. For instance: object recognition only recognizes large objects, and sometimes Botley seems confused by the lines when set to line mode, but overall it's a great toy and a fun introduction to programming.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it works before gifting to someone
customer_reviews.text: The botley we received is broken and will not work correctly. Very disappointed as its a gift. Our original botley purchased at a big box retailer works very well and my kids love it. If you buy here just test it out before your 30 day return window is up.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect coding toy for young children
customer_reviews.text: Botley is a cute, fun, inexpensive (at below $35 currently) coding toy option that is great for kids under 10 (and possibly older, as my husband enjoys him too!). He is easy to use, works well, comes with a lot of activities and accessories to try (unlike many of the expensive coding robots) and is very durable. My kids aged 2, 5, 6 and 8 have all had fun with Botley. My 6 year old has used a $100 coding robot at school as part of their coding lesson, but it wasn't any more valuable than Botley. I highly recommend him.
customer_reviews.author: HStanley

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this!!!! Highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this Botley! I recommend getting this set! It is totally worth the money!!! The educational value alone is worth the price. We love to watch our kids think and process what steps they need to take to complete their mission! (Even adults have to stop to think about what they need to do!) Botley is so much fun to play with and we look forward to our family time together playing with this! Each time brings a new experience and we continue to add challenges to increase our kids’ development and growth! Incredible toy!
customer_reviews.author: Charity Austin

customer_reviews.title: Never Worked
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift from Santa for our 7-year-old son, and Botley never worked for us. Botley initially did some of the codes, but then got really hot and stopped working. We took the batteries out and gave him a rest, hoping he would work better at a later date. We finally took him out again, with brand new batteries, and he still will not work. :( Such a disappointment. Hoping customer service might take note and help our family out with a new Botley or some assistance in getting him to work again!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Adorable, fun toy that doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it on sale for $56. My kids love it but it doesn’t work properly. At first I thought it was my error, but it’s not. I reached out to the company to find out if he has a warranty and will update here with the resolution.
customer_reviews.author: DLS

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a 7-8 year old!
customer_reviews.text: What a great toy! My daughter immediately grabbed the remote and loved figuring out how to get Botley to move around the room. My husband read the instructions in the manual and gave her tips on how to teach Botley some cool tricks. There are still so many activities to do with Botley - this is not a toy that will get old soon, as there are many new ways to use the kit. My daughter runs to her room to grab Botley every time she gets home from school! I love that she is learning through play, and having fun doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna N. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Cool Learning Toy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter, who is six years old, loved playing with this little robot. She immediately loved the line function, where it follows a thick black line, but once we worked on it together figuring out how to actually program, she really got into it. The commands are simple but seem to teach the basic coding principles (although since I know nothing about coding, I’m not totally sure what the basic coding principles are). The current price point seems a bit steep (hence the four star rating), but if you want your child to get into this type of STEM learning, or if they have a natural aptitude for it, it is probably worth your consideration.
customer_reviews.author: jinxrl

customer_reviews.title: 4 year old loves this. Note it was NOT “ready to go out of the box”
customer_reviews.text: 4 year old loves it and is genuinely learning to program. Wish I had known that “assembly” was required. We Sat down Christmas Day to play with it expecting to dive right in as the box said “ready to go out of the box” or something to that nature, but I spent 10min hunting down batteries and applying stickers. 4 year old got bored and he didn’t want to play with it for a few days. If the box didn’t say that I’d have opened it and gotten it ready Christmas Eve and it would have been a much better experience.
customer_reviews.author: chuckda4th

customer_reviews.title: Good toy steep curve for a 5 year-old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year-old daughter, and she loves it. The intro activities are an excellent guide for young starters. My daughter did become frustrated and wanted me to help her more, but she did stick with it. Due to holiday travelers, my daughter has only played with the robot for one day; yet, it seems like this bot has staying power in her thoughts. She even took it out later in the day to show mom how it worked, and she was using it better... meaning she was using the cards to document her coding.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley T. Andresen

customer_reviews.title: An excellent learning toy for kids 7+
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a 7 year old and he really enjoyed learning and playing with it. The material is excellent - provides a good grip, and very durable. The only problem I ran into was that on making it do 90 degree turns, it didn't turn all the way. Most likely a problem with one of the motors. It wasn't so bad - we were able to complete all the activities in the booklet, and some of our own - it just took us more than a couple of tries sometimes because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and actually educational, you can skip the extras.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, 6-year-old has been motivated and able to play with it by herself, and fun thing for adult to do with her, actually teaches kids about how code works without any screen to be stared into like a zombie. Probably didn’t need the extra accessories which can be substituted for with pretty much any object. But she has enjoyed building obstacles with them.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Lots of educational fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 and 6 year olds had a lot of fun playing with Botley. I love that he is an educational toy and also very interactive. They loved that we could draw a black line and Botley would follow it. They did need a fair amount of help but I think that will decrease as they play with him more. I bought a plastic storage box with a lid to keep Botley and all his pieces together. I was a little disappointed that he didn't come with batteries. My kids were so excited to play with him when he arrived but had to wait until the next day for me to get batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Lee

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time used it quit turning right.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my granddaughters Christmas present. It sat unused for a month then only used twice when it stopped turning right. We went 5 days past their refund date. Not a good experience.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES A CARROLL

customer_reviews.title: It is ok...
customer_reviews.text: This product is great and he still has room for improvement... The product has lots of small pieces which it is very time consuming to prepare and assemble. My son was very excited for the first week... Three weeks later Botley is inside the box ever since, he completely lost interest. I noticed I was more interested in the toy than him... lol 🤷🏾‍♂️ Now in search of another product that I could continue to introduce coding.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a fantastic purchase for my just turned 4 year old as an intro to coding. Highly recommend. After he figured it out, he now various what he has Botley do. Keeps his focus. Great toy. On a side note, he plays and codes on his own.
customer_reviews.author: whiisper

customer_reviews.title: NOT what I expected...
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations! After having Beebot in my classroom last year. Now I’m wondering if to just pay more. I liked the idea of a remote control. BUT... My students and I have been having trouble with the remote and the transfer of information to Botley after pressing “go” many times NOTHING happens. It’s stressful to keep turning it on and off and having to code over AND over again. I will reach out to the distributor.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Engaging fun for the kids (AND the adults)
customer_reviews.text: I think Botley is the best gift for any child over the age of 5. My son and I have a lot of fun challenging each other to knew obstacle courses and are even trying to write words by taping a marker to Botley's arm and using a large piece of cardboard under him. At this price, I think it's one of the best buys on the internet!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Tengelitsch

customer_reviews.title: A great toy to help keep a kids mind engaged
customer_reviews.text: My 7-year-old son got this for Christmas and he loved it. We were at his grandparents' house and he played with it several hours a day. We would set up obstacles and challenges for Botley and he would enter the coding steps to get him through it. It was great fun for him and he was doing some critical thinking while playing. We had to pack it back in the box to take it home and he sadly has not unboxed it again. I am hoping to get him into Botley again because it is a great toy and tool.
customer_reviews.author: G. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Does not stop beeping!
customer_reviews.text: Remote starts beeping every time we try to play with it. The only way to stop is to take out the batteries. No help in the manual either. Poor instructions-poor quality
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: We gave this as a gift to our 5 year old on his birthday because we didn't want just another toy lying around the house and he loves it! In fact, both he and our 7 year old love it. It isn't too complicated so they can do it on their own and they love that you can make your own courses. For the price, this is a great gift idea!
customer_reviews.author: Lmb

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts...
customer_reviews.text: We've just opened Botley and started to use him when we discovered that we did not get the orange ring - which is disappointing. Also, we tried to get him to follow a solid (appropriate thickness) black line on a long sheet of white paper and he could not do it. If not for these two things would likely have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon junkie

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Love this toy! A great introduction to coding robots for my 8 year old. Easy to use but also enough variety of functions that he doesn’t get bored. Would recommend to any beginner robot lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift for granddaughter--big hit!
customer_reviews.text: Sent to 6 yr. old granddaughter for Christmas and it has apparently been well received and is getting a lot of play time. I don't know if she understands the simple "coding" aspect of this STEM toy, but as long as she is having fun with it, I guess she will pick up on the "educational" aspect of it in time.
customer_reviews.author: ModGrandma

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: My son is 3.5 and loves this. He uses it mostly in coding mode. There is definitely room for him to grow with it, which is nice. He is just starting to learn that when buttons are pressed in an order they then are done in that order. Leads to great conversation and learning!
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: We are a homeschooling family and love toys that teach STEM concepts
customer_reviews.text: We are a homeschooling family and love toys that teach STEM concepts! Botley has provided hours of fun for my kids 6, 8 and 10. They have programmed Botley through an obstacle course, used the object detection feature to avoid having him hit barriers, and improved their critical thinking on multi-step processes. And it's fun! Botley's little voice is SO cute! I'm thankful to have found this creative, engaging screen-free activity for my kids!
customer_reviews.author: Super7

customer_reviews.title: Coding fun
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this product. We have had children from ages 4 (almost 5) up to almost 10 playing with Botley. We were trying it out as a family and then the neighbors came over and wanted in on the fun. I love that you can either use the cards to come up with a code or you can make it up yourself. The almost 10 year old girl said that her input would be that it isn’t easy but it is a lot of fun. I also like how the children have to problem solve their way through the activity. We are going to try the black line activity next!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Baker

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product on March 9, 2019. A month later-and after scarcely any use- it stopped working. We changed batteries several times, reread the manual but nothing helped. We stored it in the closet and rediscovered it during our Covid19 quarantine (both husband and I were sick). Unfortunately, when we contacted the company for replacement they said that we are past the one year replacement date (by about a month). We are disappointed given the dozens of products we purchased from this company. I suggest they adopt the customer service practices of Lego. They never disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: For My Grandson
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson's 5th birthday but someone had already given him one so I returned mine. The robot itself is amazing. If he'd not already received one he would have kept this one.
customer_reviews.author: Alabama Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Cute learning resource
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my seven year old granddaughter for Christmas. She was enjoying it within five minutes of opening it. Arrived in a timely manner, and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: quilt lover

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for our little 5yo coder.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for our little coder! He spent hours with the remote control for it and laying out the different tracks. Wish there were more track pieces, but very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Dad K

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a very bright tech savvy 7 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old grandson enjoyed this right out of the box. He usually finds most things like this lame, but this was a winner. We played for awhile and didn’t scratch the surface of what I’m sure this little guy can do. I would have appreciated more ideas in the instructions but I’ll try the website to see what we can come up with. Batteries were included and ...get this...they included enough extra batteries for one additional change in the robot. Nice touch!
customer_reviews.author: Mama T

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew and he seemed to enjoy it. It has several extra activities . I only saw it briefly but it was cute and I can see why a kid would enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Lightning purchase w full price case, robots named P as it doesnt work!
customer_reviews.text: Robot does not work. But we just opened it this week as it matched our homeschool schedule and sadly found our robot to not function. Even bought a matching case with it! Amazon sold defunct product during the lightning deal. Shady. Past return window for both robot and case. Save your $100, buy in a store. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Your kids must have
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING for toddlers, my kids loves it! Easy to use, great gift for a 3 years old
customer_reviews.author: R.Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review lost money
customer_reviews.text: So we ordered this gift 2 months earlier before our sons birthday for $40. Our son opened his present, we began setting everything up, come to find out the set was missing the goal and stickers. It also haS the batteries installed into the remote and bot itself already! The batteries were corroded which ultimately caused the programming and bot to not work. :(. We ordered two months in advance so the return policy had ended :( We ordered a new one yesterday right after opening, got it the next day and works perfectly. We used our own batteries as there were none in the box, have all pieces, and are now enjoying learning and playing!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee M Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Only one instruction and then non-stopping spinning
customer_reviews.text: Some time ago I bought botley the coding robot. But I hadn't taken the time to write. Every time I send him a code, he only performs the first instruction and then starts to turn to the right without stopping. I have to press the stop button to stop him spinning, otherwise it could do it for hours until the batteries run out. I check that wheels work well, change the batteries. I think something is wrong with the programming.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Purchase AAA batteries
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love Botley! My kids are 4 and 7, after reading the instructions together they quicklu figured it out and they loved it! I own many learning resources sets and this is just another example if how user friendly this company makes things for busy families. Everything we needed to enjoy this toy is right in the box and the price is much better than other coding robots that perform similar tasks. My kids loved tjat he talked and couldnt get over how cute he was. Wr will definitely be using this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: 1234Girl

customer_reviews.title: Cute robot
customer_reviews.text: I honestly thought my son would play with this more than he has. It just kind of gets lost with the other toys he has. However, it is a really neat toy. But you will definitely have to help them learn how to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: I bought this robot for my niece’s birthday. She really enjoyed it. I love that it’s an educational toy and fun at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: S. V

customer_reviews.title: it is great STEM toy to have
customer_reviews.text: Screen free coding is really working and I'm so proud of my kids' accomplishments they made with Botley! My 3.5 year old enjoys chasing me in the kitchen. Our friends were visiting us and when I offered to open Botley and show kids how to play they said "It's coding toy, It will take 5 hrs to set everything". Next day morning it took me exactly 5 mins to start it!!! Week later we laugh at 5 hrs estimate. In short, it is great STEM toy to have. And make cute sounds while it turns,goes in sleep mode etc...What a perfect little companion for my 3.5 & 8 year old!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: This little coding robot is so adorable! My daughter just loves him
customer_reviews.text: This little coding robot is so adorable! My daughter just loves him. She is 8 and currently enrolled in a STEM school! They have other Learning Resources products in her classroom so I knew that they were good and that my daughters teacher likes the brand! Botley does so many different things and there are tons of games to play! My daughter is coding and programming and having fun at the same time! I would definitely recommend the Learning Resources brand of products! They really do make educational games and learning fun... Botley will be adored and played with for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: LMDx3

customer_reviews.title: Super cute and fun
customer_reviews.text: Botley has been a huge hit with our 5 year old. It was on his wishlist since before Xmas so he was thrilled to finally receive it for his bday. Botley is cute and has kept all my kids’ attention; 6, 5, and 2. The only reason I dock a star is because for some reason pretty soon after opening, Botley doesn’t run completely straight. I don’t know what happened, but it’s a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: mmporter

customer_reviews.title: Fun, cute, and educational
customer_reviews.text: I think Botley is now a family pet 😄 My kids all love him. He was a gift for my 6 year old son, but really Botley is like a member of the family. He's cute, he follows instructions (better than my kids sometimes,) says cute little phrases, and naps well. But purchase a box of tissues because Botley also sneezes! This toy is a practical and simple way to learn the basics of coding, and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Came with missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Everything looks well made. But it was very disappointing to not play with it due to missing parts Before I cut the bag containing the pieces, went through the parts list. It's missing flags and a arms. Asked for a replacement. Will update after I get that
customer_reviews.author: playtime

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing STEM toy for little ones to start learning how ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing STEM toy for little ones to start learning how to code! My 7-year-old has done a coding workshop at Apple, but Botley makes commands simple, but will grow with your child as advanced thinking to create up to 80 step command strings can be coded. I also like that it is not just a remote controlled robot, but requires your child to think and design - challenging them while having fun.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L

customer_reviews.title: Botley is such fun! I teach a digital literacy college course
customer_reviews.text: Botley is such fun! I teach a digital literacy college course, so I am all about getting my five and eight year olds interested in coding. This is a perfect toy for that! I also love that it is screenless. Admittedly, my kids are addicted to their tablets and gaming systems, but since we received botley, they haven’t complained about disconnecting because they can play with it! My daughter (5) loves watching botley follow the black line, while my son (8) is fascinated by the loops and if/then programming. Hours of entertainment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Xmas gift - no longer works after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Expensive gift that only worked for 2 months- of course, past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Toy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome learning toy! Bought it for our newly 6 year old for Christmas and he (and his dad) have very much enjoyed playing with it and coding. We also got the accessories kit but it’s not necessary, but does add to the things it can do. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Eye

customer_reviews.title: Don’t forget the batteries!!
customer_reviews.text: We are really enjoying Botley. I love having toys on hand for my children that don’t involve a television or a phone! We were able to use Botley right away and it kept the kids (5 and 7) entertained for a solid hour. Whoo hoo!! It is very easy to use and lots of fun to try out the different obstacles. My boys think it is really neat that he can move things around. I would not get the bigger one if I could do it again though. It has way too many pieces for us and we would have had just as much fun with the smaller set.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yr old wanted kozmo and I thought it was too advanced and I didn’t want the screen time. I opt’d for this on with the starter activity set and the action activity set. She will not put this down, my husband won’t put it down, everyone thinks it’s fun and cute. I’m just thrilled it’s not tablet controlled or operated. Hope more accessories come out! Or a book on all the fun things to try.
customer_reviews.author: Shopdrop

customer_reviews.title: Great opportunity for STEM
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old couldn’t wait to get this out of the box! With some help, she was able to set it up and start using it right away. We love the accessories that allow her to explore and do beginning programming. We are happy that all programming is done with a remote and no screen is needed. The book came with some fun activities to get her started and she’s loves coming up with her own ideas. We wish there was a better option to power it instead of 5 AAA batteries. We have replaced multiple times and probably need rechargeables. It seems that Botley could have been made rechargeable on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dripps

customer_reviews.title: This is really for a 3-4 year old.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, Botley is sweet looking and sounding, very inviting to a younger child. My 6 year old son had never did anything with coding so I watched video after video, reviews after reviews and finally purchased him one. Botley is great for exactly what the video's show. However, he got bored really fast and started using it like a remote toy, like a remote controlled car without all the pieces and cards. He doesn't seem to maneuver like I thought too. I think a 3/4 year old would really like Botley.
customer_reviews.author: Mom/Teacher

customer_reviews.title: It's great to watch him puzzle things out and problem solve ...
customer_reviews.text: Our son (9 y/o) loves him. It's great to watch him puzzle things out and problem solve ways to get Botley to do what he wants, and we all had fun setting up obstacle courses and different programs for the robot to follow. The controls can be quite picky and sensitive, so that does add some frustration for my son, and the arms don't seem to have much of a useful function, but other than that, the battery life seems good and it's definitely teaching our son some great lessons, cause and effect, and challenging him to use the items in the set in new, fun ways.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to introduce kids to coding
customer_reviews.text: My kiddos have been having a blast with Botley and I love that they are being introduced to coding. With his simple design he is perfect for my 5 year old while my 8 year old enjoys planning out more complex codes. The included guide includes basic tasks to help users get the hang of controlling Botley along with several more challenging ideas. I also really appreciate that it is completely screen free! I would recommend Botley for all little learners!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Two codes in and stops working
customer_reviews.text: Buy if you want to utterly disappoint your child. My daughter opened this for her birthday and was so excited. We had to go out and buy batteries. We finally got them in, she entered two codes, and it completely shut off. Now it does not even turn on. We tried replacing the batteries, turning it off and on again, and to no effect. Returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to teach the young one’s
customer_reviews.text: Kids have fun while learning simple coding. Easy for any parent to teach
customer_reviews.author: Gary Greene

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, almost like a virtual pet that moves!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old could figure this out without help, set up commands, played with the coding cards, and made it to the targets! Even my 3 year old was in giggles as botley "accomplished his goals." We played together as a family - what awesome STEM fun!! Add your own batteries and enjoy for many many hours!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: This item was a birthday girly for my son. We put in all the proper batteries and everything turned on, but when you try to code something or use the lines nothing happens. This is really upsetting. This was the one gift my son was the most excited about. Will not purchase again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Emily dudasko

customer_reviews.title: Cannot follow a simple black line.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it back in July 2020 and I just open the item October 2020 and Botley cannot follow a simple black line as directed. Either it is ineffective from factory or the item is not doing what it is supposed to do. I cannot return the item now because my window has closed. I am wish that I could get some help.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: The robot was easy for my 7 year old to figure out and ...
customer_reviews.text: We received Botley this morning and within minutes my 7 and 5 year old had the package open and ready to roll. The robot was easy for my 7 year old to figure out and then explain how to use to my 5 year old. My husband and I even enjoyed taking turns to use Botley. I love how this engaged my children and provided them with hours of creative thinking (hooray no one asked for an iPad)! Botley is a must have!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome way to learn programming
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use and learn for a young child. My 5 year old Granddaughter gets a kick out programming Botley to wander about the kitchen and dodge obstacles she set in its path. She'll add steps that get Botley to 'dance' (turn in circles) then move on. Clear the code and send a new sequence and do something else... If this is 5, what will we have in a few years. (I get a kick out of it too)
customer_reviews.author: David and Robin O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for kids! My 4 year old has leaned how to code and is enjoying telling Botley what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Just okay...
customer_reviews.text: My four year old loves it, my eight year old not so much. Both seemed to put it down rather quickly though. I was expecting a little more from it based on the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney S.

customer_reviews.title: 9 year old daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was crying happy tears Christmas morning over this so it’s a win in my book!
customer_reviews.author: Jen L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It was so fun to watch the daddy and daughter I bought it for program together while daddy explained programming in an understandable way to a 5 year-old. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Price constantly changing
customer_reviews.text: I can’t speak to whether or not this works like it should, whether or not it’s as fun as it looks, but I am frustrated that the price has declined significantly since I purchased and Amazon want to charge me almost $10 to return/ exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Thronson

customer_reviews.title: Botley, our new pet robot
customer_reviews.text: Botley is super cute. All my kids are having a lot of fun with him...ages 5-11. I was worried the 5 year old wouldn't catch on to how to program him, but he caught on quick. My 7 year old daughter treats him like a pet. The noise feature can turn off while playing, so that's a major plus.
customer_reviews.author: adam atkinson

customer_reviews.title: They both equally love Botley! My 5 year old is able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two sons ages 8 and 5. They both equally love Botley! My 5 year old is able to use Botley without much input from adults. Botley comes with all sorts of little toys that you can use as obstacles. My kids want me to buy another one so they each have one.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole S

customer_reviews.title: Recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I gave it four star because I had to return it! The product was missing some pieces! I decided to buy the brought again through another website! Over all my kids love it. Keeps them busy for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Poonam

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my 7 year old. She loves it and I love seeing her think and strategize to learn new tricks for Botley. It encourages critical thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Its a fun toy but my kids weren't to interested in it
customer_reviews.text: I think the agend range on this should be higher. My 5 year old played with him for 2 minutes but didn't really get what he did. My six year old understood a little better but got very frustrated with it when he couldn't get it to do what he wanted it to do. I think it's a good toy I enjoyed playing with it but I believe it would be better for an 8 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Super Cool Coding Toy
customer_reviews.text: This coding robot is amazing! I have a 4 and 6 year old and they are both enthralled with it!! Super easy set up, my 6 year old figured it out before I was even done reading through the directions. Botley can detect and avoid objects, follow looping commands and paths, and even has little quirky phrases. The kids enjoy it so much that it's the first thing they ask to play when they get up and/or get home from school... And how can you say no to something that is teaching them and there is absolutely no screen time?!
customer_reviews.author: meg

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful educational toy
customer_reviews.text: This little cute robot is amazing, great way to teach kids the concepts of coding and problem solving
customer_reviews.author: moms shopping guide

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My six-year-old daughter loves this toy! Her older siblings are enjoying it too. She can program all the functions and even uses it to send Post-It messages to us in another room or give small stuffed animals a ride. It’s fantastic—great play value. We have all wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great Robot
customer_reviews.text: This made a great gift for my little ones, however, my older ones tend to get a little jealous. I wish there were more objects so they could provide a larger obstacle course. I will be purchasing again. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Harris STREAM Team/Level 8 Publishing

customer_reviews.title: Bad Toy. Not durable even two days
customer_reviews.text: After two days after Christmas the robot stops working. Just turn on the lines and nothing more. So was a bad moment for my kid because was a Santa gift. I'm on ecuador right now, so return is not possible for me. Money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: George Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational Toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little robot that's easy to learn. My kids quickly caught on about how to use code the robot to get it to move how they wanted. They enjoyed completing the challenges. I enjoyed seeing my kids play and learn something new. This is as easy or as complicated as your child needs it to be, which is so fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: BOTLEY is the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: MY WHOLE FAMILY ENJOYS BOTLEY. I got him a week or two ago for my 8 year old son, since then, WEVE ALL BEEN TAKING TURNS! Lol. It’s a very easy and advanced toy. It’s a learning tool at the same time. I find it fun and beneficial for my sons introduction to coding. We love BOTLEY! My pictures will prove it lol. His voice is ADORABLE, his phrases catchy and sweet. His movements are VERY HIGH TECH. He can detect items and he has SUCH A VARIETIES OF TOYS/TASKS THAT ARE INCLUDED! I highly recommend it to teach your child or play with the whole family! He goes everywhere with my son!
customer_reviews.author: Fahlon Napolitano

customer_reviews.title: A toy that grows with your child
customer_reviews.text: We received The Botley activity pack over the weekend. It has been everything we hoped it would be. The product itself is well made and easy to use. It requires 5 AAA batteries before it is ready to use but outside of that it is ready to go! My daughter loved using the robot in line and coding mode. It robot is e gaging and interactive and the possibilities are endless. The activity pack includes 75 blocks, cones, balls and joiners that allow you to create obstacles courses to challenge your sequencing and coding skills. We have spent hours in screen free play and love it.
customer_reviews.author: JVS

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Very nice but kinda dont play with it been sitting in box since Christmas
customer_reviews.author: Ronald shifflett

customer_reviews.title: Fun and super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My kids really enjoyed this item - especially my six year old daughter. It was very easy for her to figure out how to use it in the different modes. She is still learning how to program around obstacles but really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Screen Free Coding.  And a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.text: Botley arrived today. I'm in love with the screen free coding. My five year old was home and couldn't wait to get it out of the box. He's had so much fun so far, his favorite thing is to make Botley "talk". My seven year old is having more fun coding Botley. She's been using the cards to "write" her code and using trial and error to get it right. This is a big hit so far. I can't wait for them to start making obstacle courses for Botley.
customer_reviews.author: Roro

customer_reviews.title: Not All of That...
customer_reviews.text: The coding part is being confusing even for adults or maybe this one is just not working. Either way I will return since I don't want to bother with another one not working...
customer_reviews.author: Jewelz7

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning toy
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 year old grandson loved this gift. It was fun to watch him and daddy “program” the robot to do the commands they wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi H.

customer_reviews.title: Wastes batteries
customer_reviews.text: The remote controller does not turn off. This means that you place the two AAA batteries and by the next time the toy comes out- the batteries need to be replaced. What a waste!!! It is a bummer bc my 5 yr old loves the toy. We have gone through dozens of batteries over the past few weeks. I have learned my lesson purchasing electronics from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Endless play, both 5 yr old girl and 6 yr old boy love it, it's easy to use it but you can make it as challenging as you want... It's entertaining, finally play that it's not just junk for their little brains!
customer_reviews.author: Murderous Crow

customer_reviews.title: Our 8 year old loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Give your child a leg up, coding will be important in their future world! This is a fun activity while teaching them coding and our little guy has a ball with it! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids. Maybe 7 and up
customer_reviews.text: Omg my son loves this little robot and has a blast playing with it. I would say it is for older kids he is 7 and can read so that helps. He loves figuring out how to code what he needs to get it to go threw the course he sets up
customer_reviews.author: whitley davidson

customer_reviews.title: Robotics
customer_reviews.text: Bought for son great product he is 10 and loves robotics love the fact it doesn’t need a app. I thought it may be to young for him but actually he has been created with different things he builds for him.
customer_reviews.author: kittycatbutt

customer_reviews.title: Botley is a great screenless coding robot my children love it
customer_reviews.text: Botley is a great screenless coding robot my children love it. I feel my 11yr old boy and 9 year old girl had the most fun and understanding of this product. My 6 year old boy did more button mashing then actual coding. The cardboard pieces it comes with are a bit warped so it slides when Botley is driving across them. One other con is that it takes 5 AAA batteries. Over all my kids love it and even my husband enjoyed playing with Botely. You can be very creative and the possibilities are endless a great screen free robot!
customer_reviews.author: M. Lau

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive not to work at all!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Botley right before Christmas last year, but decided to wait until a Christmas this year to gift it to our son (he was 4 last year, and this year he is 5). Just got it out of the box... and the code function doesn’t work at all! It is as if he isn’t receiving signals from the remote... we’ve tried new batteries, adjusting the lighting, etc. so disappointed, usually we’ve really enjoyed Learning Resources toys.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: It's great. My kids love it and it's easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this robot and tested whether its programming ability is useful for children. After testing, it is not only suitable for children of the same age, but also useful for older children. Children are very involved and fascinated with it. Generally speaking, it is very helpful for children and greatly improves their hands-on ability. It is also very simple and easy to use. It is highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Harris

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my 5 year old and he absolutely loved it. He creates different mazes and is able to figure out the coding. Very user friendly and great for kids !
customer_reviews.author: Martha Muniz Armendariz

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Botley the Coding Robot Activity Set, Homeschool, Coding Robot for Kids, STEM Toy, Programming for Kids, Ages 5+
product_meta.description: Meet Botley, the code to fun! As the newest member of the Learning Resources Family, Botley the Coding robot is here to introduce coding in an easy, friendly way. Children as young as 5 can learn to code with Botley, and with his advanced features, he can grow with them for many years to come. Botley is ready to use right out of the box, so he will have kids coding in minutes (plan ahead: Botley requires 5 AAA batteries, not included). Botley is also 100% screen free; no phone or tablet required. Explore Botley's advanced features and code him for up to 80 steps, with 40 more you can discover. He can also follow looping commands or be programmed to go around objects with If/then logic. Turn on the black-line follow mode and set up a path for Botley to travel. Botley even has hidden features to unlock! Botley includes a one-piece activity set, which includes coding cards, detachable arms, interactive obstacles, and code games that are ready for endless hours of fun and learning. Learning coding With Botley helps kids foster creativity and develop problem solving and critical thinking skills!
feature_bullets: EARLY STEM SKILLS: Botley helps your child learn early STEM skills while playing and having fun. He teaches kids to code with active, screen-free play that's perfect for promoting critical thinking and problem solving skills

READY RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX: Botley is ready to code right out of the box! Have 5 AAA batteries and a Phillips screwdriver nearby and this coding robot will have your kid coding in minutes with code games, creativity and fun (3 AAA batteries for Botley and 2 AAA for the remote programmer)

SCREEN-FREE: Botley features completely screen-free coding: no phone or tablet required. Botley's easy-to-use remote programmer sends commands and gets him rolling. Coding for kids has never been easier

SMART LOGIC: Botley has the ability to detect objects in front of him and avoid them. He can also follow looping commands, take on obstacle courses, and follow black-line paths. He even has hidden features to unlock

77-PIECE ACTIVITY SET: Coding robots are great at learning new things, so Botley comes with a remote programmer, detachable robot arms, 40 coding cards, 6 double-sided tiles, 27 obstacle building pieces and a starter guide with coding challenges

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars857 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
